connections.description: Major Connections
connections.details: There is at least one major connection between the books which will enhance your understanding of the plot and the Cosmere. Reading in this order is highly recommended, and reading out of order may be spoilery.

connections.description: Significant Connections
connections.details: There is at least one significant connection between the books which may enhance your understanding of the plot and the Cosmere. Reading in this order is recommended.

connections.description: Minor Connections
connections.details: There is at least one minor connection between the books which may enhance your understanding of the plot and Cosmere in a small way.

connections.description: Easter Eggs
connections.details: There is at least one subtle reference between the books which may hint at something bigger going on. Easter eggs may be very difficult to spot unaided.

categories.details: Essential Phase 1 works should be read before moving to Phase 2.
Secondary Phase 1 works may be read during Phase 1 or anytime after.
Essential Phase 2 works should be read after all essential Phase 1 works and before moving to Phase 3.
Secondary Phase 2 works may be read during Phase 2 or anytime after.
Includes all planned, future cosmere stories. Likelihood of publication varies. Known publication dates may be in parenthesis. Titles are tentative.
Includes unpublished, apocryphal stories. Some elements may be part of the official continuity. Some may be published in the future while others will not.

connections.description: The map in Elantris refers to 'Rose Barbarians'. There are mentions of Svorden, Teod, and Sycla. When escaping the palace, Shai runs into a Derethi priest (wearing red armor). When she steals the painting she inscribes an Aon Reo in its place.
The Ire are Elantrians. Their symbol is Aon Ire.

Galladon appears in Interlude I-1 as 'Grump'. Note his use of 'sule' (friend) and 'kolo' (understand) as well as the Dula word 'kayana' (crazy). Also, Aona and Skai are mentioned in the Chapter 22 epigraph.
Riino, the lighthouse owner in Chapter 97, is the Elantrian Raoden and Galladon lowered into the mountain lake.
The nature of Sel's magic is discussed in the Selish system essay.
A deleted prologue that contains some canonical elements.
The nature of Sel's magic is discussed in the Selish system essay.
Lemex's nurse is a Terriswoman.
Demoux appears in Interlude I-1 as 'Thinker'; Ishikk mishears his name as 'Temoo'. Ruin's vesSel, Ati, is mentioned in the Chapter 18 epigraph. Felt worked for the Ventures on Scadrial.
The Part 2 epigraphs include a letter from Sazed to Hoid. Felt reveals he is from another world.
The Scadrian system essay discusses the events that occurred in The Hero of Ages.

books.title: Allomancer Jak
books.title2: Allomancer Jak and the Pits of Eltania

connections.description: Iyatil is from Southern Scadrial.
Kelsier's survival is revealed in The Bands of Mourning.
With powers gained from the lerasium he took, Hoid uses emotional Allomancy in Chapter 45.
Hoid and Frost discuss the events of Hero of Ages (and Mistborn: Secret History).
Zahel is Vasher. Szeth's new Shardblade is Nightblood. Mraize's collection in Chapter 43 includes a Tear of Edgli flower.

Azure is Vivenna; she uses Awakening. Nightblood and Vasher make significant appearances. Nightblood mentions Denth, Shashara, and Vivenna by name. A painting from the Court of the Gods appears in Chapter 102. Riino mentions Heightenings. Hoid uses Awakening in the Epilogue.
A deleted scene about Jasnah that contains some canonical elements.
The author of the Part 4 epigraphs is Frost the dragon, who speaks with Hoid.
The Rosharan system essay covers details about Roshar and makes mentions of Odium's past.

books.title: King Lopen the First of Alethkar
books.title2: King Lopen the First of Alethkar

connections.description: 'Kenton Street' in Chapter 17 (also mentioned in Well of Ascension) is a reference to Kenton.
Mraize's collection in Chapter 43 includes a vial of sand from Taldain.
The Taldain system essay discusses Taldain and sand mastery.
Trell the foreman is connected to Trelagism.
Trell the foreman is connected to the god Trell.
Wit has a jar of black sand from Taldain in Chapter 67, which turns white after Shallan Lightweaves.
Baon appears in Interlude I-1 as 'Blunt'.

books.title: Shadows for Silence
books.title2: Shadows for Silence in the Forests of Hell

connections.description: Mraize's collection in Chapter 43 includes a silver knife from Threnody.
The silvery chain in Celebrant is from Threnody.
Kelsier causes the Ire to suspect Shades from Threnody are nearby.
The Threnodite system essay discusses the history of Threnody.
Mraize's chicken, mentioned in Chapter 22, is an Aviar. Patji is referenced obliquely in Autonomy's letter to Hoid in the Part 2 epigraphs.
The Drominad system essay discusses First of the Sun and its magic.

books.title: White Sand (prose)
books.link: Full text link via Brandon's newsletter

connections.description: The White Sand graphic novels are based on the prose version.
Mraize's collection in Chapter 43 includes pink aether.
Mraize mentions his suit was stained with aether.
